http://www.usatoday.com/story/happyeverafter/2015/03/17/denny-s-bryce-fan-fiction-recs-doctor-who-star-trek-farscape/24907897/

Hi, 

This month I made recs from Star Trek, Doctor Who, and Farscape. And I had some help from a gal named Deb, some of you may know ...

A huge thank you to all of my LIVE JOURNAL pals for visiting the blog post. Please email me if you'd like to make any recs in any fandom for me to consider for future posts - you know I trust your recs:)! 

The first blog post was a lot of fun, and did really well! So, I'll be back at it again next month!

Banner above created by . Thank you! This journal is friends only. And hey, I'm updating this post - finally. Seriously Moonlight has been off the air a year (or more) so it's time to move on, right? Well kind of. Since it's demise the world of vampires and werewolves (I'm really into them now) has exploded! So friends, if you're already on the train, I won't leave you at the station, you'll have to jump off on your own, but I hope you won't, but it's your ride. My fandoms are 'being human', True Blood, Terminator: The Sarah Connor Chronicles (I know cancelled), and I'm still a diehard fan of Buffy the Vampire Slayer, Angel and Moonlight - okay, vampires in general a strong theme. And Vampire Diaries is even on my list. Also new on my list in 2011 is Fringe and The Vampire Diaries. FANDOM UPDATE - I am also completely wowed by Leverage - new on my fandom list. I also write original and used to write fanfiction - when I post, it can range from the wildly personal stuff (which I filter) to going on and on about my latest television craze. I live in Washington, DC. I'm constantly busy, so there are spells when I will post absolutely nothing. I also write about work and my family and my writing. Peace.

I haven't written a fic in a while, but I recently wrote a Leverage fan fiction. I joined a community that does a bunch of challenges, and I decided to participate in one which asked for a short fic using the prompt - Major Character Death. My entry didn't count, but fic is fic. So check it out and let me know what you think...

Title: Sleepless by Denny
Word Count: 500
Warnings (if any): Language - R - a bit of profanity.
Unscreen after voting? (Yes)
Submission: A sleepless Eliot remembers his last Christmas.

Lying in bed, Eliot pulled his fingers through his hair and then sat up. He couldn’t sleep, and didn't want to waste time pretending he could. 

He glanced at the clock on the nightstand. It was three o’clock. 

Morning? Afternoon? Shit. He didn’t know. Didn’t care.

When was the last time he’d slept? Christmas. No. Christmas Eve. 

He was sitting on the sofa staring at the big screen, praying Hardison and Parker would shut up. The NBA strike was over and the Celtics were kicking ass under the boards. 

Eliot closed his eyes. The memories were killing him. But he didn’t want to forget.

Hardison and Parker were going on and on about the damn Christmas gifts under Nate’s tree. They wouldn’t stop until New Year’s if he didn’t put an end to it. 

“Children, shut up,” he growled. “Pick straws. One of you has to open a gift first. Okay?”

Two pairs of mournful eyes looked up at him. He could see the pouts coming a mile away. He hated it when one of them pouted, especially Hardison. It looked so wrong.

“Okay. It’s a big deal,” he said. “Your first Christmas. Together. Who opens their gift first. But if you don’t open one of the gifts, you’ll never open the rest of them. So, I’ll decide who goes first. You win.” He pointed at Hardison. “You go. I win. She goes.” He extended a clenched fist, and gave Hardison an encouraging nod. “Rock, paper, scissors.”

Hardison jumped to his feet, confident, with big swag, and Eliot fought to keep from laughing. His tell was still visible from other side of the moon. 

Hardison stood wide-legged in front of Eliot. Big eyes. Intense. Purposeful. He’d won the last time. Could do it again. Eliot knew that was what he was thinking. And he had won. Eliot glanced at Parker who was sitting on the floor next to the tree, looking at Hardison. Eyes shiny. Smiling. Happy. 

He wouldn’t win tonight. 

The two of them had to stop fussing and open their gifts so Eliot could get back to watching the game and drinking his beer.

Eliot hit the side of his head with the heel of his hand. The fucking memories had to stop. His head would blow apart if they didn’t. 

He and Hardison were facing each other, hands ready. He would win in another second, but Parker. OMG. Parker. She had ripped open her gift from Hardison, tearing it apart frantically. Her excited voice, giggly with joy. 

“I love it!” And before Hardison could lose again, she had wrapped her arms around him and was kissing him. Hugging him close. 

Finally. Eliot could watch the game. Finish his beer.

On the nightstand, next to the clock, a bottle of Jack. Half empty. 

Next to him in the bed, a blonde. Half dead.

She hadn’t smiled since...the same day. The same moment. 

The same reason Eliot couldn’t sleep now. 

Damn it, Hardison. 

Why did you have to die?

The End.

Dang, it's been so long I can't remember how to do a 'cut' tag...

Little-Known Black History Fact: Bass Reeves


Watching "Justified" on fX and they mentioned this black cowboy gunslinger. Cool facts. Might need to write story using some of these fun facts, huh?
I've still got five hours to go, but Happy New Year to the east coast of the USA!!!!

Just stopping by to wish all of my friends' list Merry Christmas and Happy Holidays. I'm hanging out in Maui this year for Xmas - a change of pace. Having a great time and enjoying the water and the sunshine. It's definitely a different kind of holiday here, but I wanted to try something new and am glad I did it.

I visit live journal daily - lurking and checking in now and then - in 2012, I'll try to post more - still have my obsessions for television shows and fanfiction - but the focus does change after a while.

You can find me regularly though on www.dennysbryce.blogspot.com - so if you'd like stop by there. In the meantime....

Happy Holidays!!!

It's this thing on my blog:)

http://dennysbryce.blogspot.com/2011/09/six-sentence-sunday-and-dennys-eye_18.html

Six Sentence Sunday & Denny's Eye Candy
http://dennysbryce.blogspot.com/2011/08/six-sentence-sunday-dennys-eye-candy.html

Hi, I'm sharing my blog here - just because...waiting for the dog days of August to eend and fall to begin, but this is a pretty morning here in DC so I'm not too mad. Hope all is well...

Yes, I actually did something this year on the 4th of July. Had a party! It was fun, exhausting and filled with good times and family and friends. But jeez...it does make Tuesday a bit of something like hell...

Anyway, I'm up to my eyebrows in post RWA National stuff. Always a good time. But this year, with it being right after my big June event - I'm still fighting fatigue.

Also I need to go back to NYC - I missed connecting with several NYC friends because I was just so scattered...

But now that I have some breathing room - do expect to see me soon:)
I feel like a broken record, but I am working. This is that big conference I do, and i have a lot of work to do. But I wish I were sitting on a beach:)

Plus Size Maxi dresses - Always For Me Mosaic






I'm thinking about buying the long version in black and the short one in white...and two suits.
So why didn't someone tell me the BBC's Luther is brilliant. Nice way to spend an insanely hot memorial day afternoon.
